marketNews.title: Indonesia's Upstream Oil and Gas Investment +13% YoY in FY23, Lifting Below Target
marketNews.content: SKK Migas has released a report on the realization of investment and performance of the upstream oil and gas sector in Indonesia during 2023. Here are the details: Investment grew +13% YoY to US$ 13.7 billion, exceeding global upstream oil and gas investment growth in the range of +6.5% YoY and marking the largest upstream oil and gas investment in Indonesia in the last 8 years. Oil lifting decreased by -1.1% YoY to 605.5 MBOPD, equivalent to 92.5% of the 2023 State Budget target and 98% of the 2023 SKK Migas target. Gas sales rose +0.6% YoY to 5,378 MMSCFD, equivalent to 87% of the 2023 State Budget target and 96.5% of the 2023 SKK Migas target. During 2023, Indonesia also successfully discovered 2 giant gas block discoveries, namely Geng North and Layaran. Both blocks are among the 5 largest natural gas block discoveries in the world in 2023, and also become Indonesia's largest discoveries since 2000. The Head of SKK Migas, Dwi Soetjipto, stated that the increase in investment in 2023 - especially for development well drilling - has been able to reduce the rate of decline in oil production and resume increasing Indonesia's gas production. For 2024, the following targets are set: Oil lifting of 596 MBOPD based on the 2024 SKK Migas target and 635 MBOPD based on the 2024 State Budget. Gas sales of 5,544 MMSCFD based on the 2024 SKK Migas target and 5,785 MMSCFD based on the 2024 State Budget. Investment in upstream oil and gas increased by +29.2% YoY to US$ 17.7 billion. Key Takeaway: The increasing trend of upstream oil and gas investment in Indonesia has the potential to bring positive impacts for issuers in oil and gas supporting services through increased job volume and better service rates, which can ultimately grow revenue and net profit. On the IDX, several issuers operating in oil and gas supporting services are ELSA, APEX, WINS, LEAD, RUIS, BBRM, and HITS. Stockbit has also released Mini Unboxing WINS and Mini Unboxing ELSA which discuss the prospects and challenges of these two stocks.

marketNews.title: CTRA: Marketing Sales FY23 +24% YoY, Exceeding Target
marketNews.content: CTRA: Ciputra Development recorded marketing sales growth of +24% YoY to IDR 10.2 trillion in FY23. This realization exceeded (105%) the FY23 target of IDR 9.8 trillion, and marked the highest marketing sales in the company's history. Landed house sales contributed 80% of the total FY23 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (17%), apartments (2%), and office spaces (1%). PANI: The controller of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua, PT Multi Artha Pratama, absorbed 2.02 billion PANI shares at a price of IDR 5,000 per share on December 6-15, 2023. The total transaction value reached IDR 10.11 trillion. After this transaction, PT Multi Artha Pratama's ownership in PANI increased from 88.07% to 89.2%. This transaction is part of a rights issue worth IDR 10.5 trillion conducted by PANI in December 2023. JARR: Jhonlin Agro Raya signed a biodiesel supply contract worth IDR 1.65 trillion from PT Pertamina Patra Niaga. This contract runs from January 1 to December 31, 2024. ELPI: The President Director of PT Pelayaran Nasional Ekalya Purnamasari, Eka Taniputra, said that the company will allocate a capex of IDR 1 trillion for 2024. These funds will be used to add 7 new fleet vessels consisting of 2 units of anchor handling tug and supply (AHTS) vessels, 2 units of landing craft transport (LCT) vessels, and 3 units of fast crew vessels. ELPI, through its business entity, PT Samudra Luas Sejahtera Abadi, will also add 1 unit of supramax mother vessel. AKRA: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased approximately 8.32 million AKRA shares at an average price of IDR 1,550.9 per share from January 2-11, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 12.89 billion. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Arthakencana Rayatama in AKRA increased from 60.18% to 60.22%.

marketNews.title: What to Watch For: Economic Data Releases (Jan 15-19, 2024) and Last Week's Releases (Jan 8-12, 2024)
marketNews.content: Some economic data that will be released this week (January 15-19, 2024): Monday (15/1): Indonesia's trade balance for December (US$ 3.3 billion, November: US$ 2.41 billion). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY economic growth for 4Q23 (consensus: 5.3%, 3Q23: 4.9%). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY housing price index for December (forecast: -0.4%, November: -0.2%). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY industrial production for December (consensus: 6.6%, November: 6.6%). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY retail sales for December (consensus: 8%, November: 10.1%). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY inflation rate for December (forecast: 5%, November: 5%). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY unemployment rate for December (forecast: 5%, November: 5%). Wednesday (17/1): China's YoY unemployment rate for December (forecast: 5%, November: 5%). Wednesday (17/1): Indonesia's credit growth rate YoY for December (December: 9.74%). Wednesday (17/1): Bank Indonesia interest rate (consensus: 6%, December: 6%). Some economic data that has been released last week (January 8-12, 2024): Indonesia: Motorcycle sales YoY December (-11.6% vs. November -2.8%). Indonesia: Foreign exchange reserves December (US$ 146.4 billion vs. November 138.1 billion). Indonesia: Consumer confidence index December (123.8 vs. November 123.6). United States: Trade balance November (-US$ 63.2 billion vs. October -US$ 64.5 billion). Indonesia: Retail sales YoY November (2.1% vs. October 2.4%). United States: Core inflation YoY December (3.9% vs. November 4%). United States: YoY inflation rate December (3.4% vs. November 3.1%). China: YoY inflation rate December (-0.3% vs. November -0.5%). China: Trade balance December (US$ 75.3 billion vs. November US$ 68.3 billion). United Kingdom: Economic growth YoY November (0.2% vs. October -0.1%). BPS noted that Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached US$ 3.3 billion in December 2023 (vs. Dec 2022: US$ 3.96 billion), exceeding consensus expectations which predicted a surplus of US$ 1.92 billion. Exports in December 2023 decreased by -5.76% YoY, while imports decreased by -3.81% YoY. Throughout 2023, Indonesia's trade balance surplus was US$ 36.93 billion (vs. 2022: US$ 54.46 billion), with exports falling -11.33% and imports weakening -6.55%. The government announced it will continue the rice social assistance (bansos) of 10 kg per month until June 2024. This assistance will target 22 million beneficiary families and is intended to anticipate rice price inflation resulting from El Nino. This assistance has been distributed since September 2023. Bloomberg reported that the Lion Air airline operator, PT Lion Mentari Airlines, is considering an IPO on the IDX to raise funds of US$ 300-500 million. Lion Air had previously planned an IPO in 2019 but it was canceled due to Covid-19. Responding to this issue, the Director of Company Assessment at the IDX, I Gede Nyoman Yetna, stated that Lion Air is not yet in the IPO pipeline at the IDX this year. While the 26 prospective IPO issuers this year already include 7 issuers listed currently. Supreme Cable Manufacturing & Commerce (SCCO) plans a 1:4 stock split. The trading schedule for the new nominal shares in the regular and negotiation markets will be on March 8, 2024. This plan will be discussed in the GMSLB on February 20, 2024. William Lai Ching-te was officially elected as the president of Taiwan in the election on Saturday (13/1). Lai currently serves as the Vice President of Taiwan and is viewed as a 'dangerous separatist' by the Chinese government.

tickerNews.title: PT Multi Artha Pratama Increases Ownership in PANI Following Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: PANI: The controller of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua, PT Multi Artha Pratama, absorbed 2.02 billion PANI shares at a price of IDR 5,000 per share on December 6-15, 2023. These funds will be used to add 7 new fleet vessels consisting of 2 units of anchor handling tug and supply (AHTS) vessels, 2 units of landing craft transport (LCT) vessels, and 3 units of fast crew vessels. ELPI, through its business entity, PT Samudra Luas Sejahtera Abadi, will also add 1 unit of supramax mother vessel.

tickerNews.title: SCCO Plans 1:4 Stock Split with New Nominal Trading on March 8, 2024
tickerNews.content: Supreme Cable Manufacturing & Commerce (SCCO) plans a 1:4 stock split. The trading schedule for the new nominal shares in the regular and negotiation markets will be on March 8, 2024. This plan will be discussed in the GMSLB on February 20, 2024.
